newsitem.title: UK: BZW head of sterling fixed income to leave.
newsitem.headline: BZW head of sterling fixed income to leave.

text.p: BZW, the investment banking unit of Barclays Plc, said on Friday that Tony Smith, chief executive of Sterling Fixed Income, will leave the firm at the end of January 1997.

As a result, sterling capital markets, sales and credit trading will be integrated in BZW's other UK/European activities under Robert Morrice while Gilts will continue to be run by David Newton as part of the European Government Bond Group.

BZW said Smith had agreed to remain with BZW last July when Bob Diamond was appointed Chief Executive of Global Markets, despite the fact he wanted to take time away from the business. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717.
